dialogues.text: No - I - I'm fine. I just wanted apologize  for stomping around in life like Bigfoot today. Virgil turns towards Amy.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Amy, you see the big tree outside?  How far is it from my front porch?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Guessing, about thirty feet.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: To you. But to me, it's fourteen steps exactly.  Fourteen steps and I arrive right where I want  to be. But -- if I run or rush, I'll lose count  and slam into it.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Told you - can't leave well enough  alone. I - I guess I should get back, start to pack...

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Rushing into trees again? Off Amy's smile we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the Porch - the two of them - sipping glasses of wine their dinner - Hungry Man beef entree - each category of it's own perfect little compartment.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You know this dinner - this is really quite...

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Ordinary?  (she laughs)  It's an acquired taste - trust me.  Jennie thinks it's the only way I'll  know where my food is. But I have a  secret weapon. (holds up a little bottle)  Hot sauce! Let's you know you're eating  something - like some. He starts to sprinkle liberally on Amy's food. Amy, laugh the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: That's OK - I'll do it.  Don't want to overdo it. She puts the bottle down - looks to Virgil - sips her win face it.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Virgil - I have to go home tomorrow...

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Wait, wait - you smell that?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: No - what?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: The winter pines - it's so strong at  night - drifts on the wind - wait -  hear the breeze then...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: There. Amy closes her eyes - takes in the scent - and they both close - taking in the night air - enjoying the moment.  And on Virgil's face we see him lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON VIRGIL - eyes closed - we hear a sound - like ni crickets. His eyes slowly open.  He rolls over - his arm reaching out for her:  But there's no one there. Virgil sits upright.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Amy? Amy is sitting in a chair by the window.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I'm here - trouble sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: C'mere. And she crawls back into bed, Virgil takes hold of her an settles into his arm, he strokes her face gently - a blin version of watching his lover fall to sleep.  BLACK - then we hear voices

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Amy's face - the voices awaken her - cutting in dreams.  She looks out the doorway - sees Virgil and Jenny arguing front porch. She can't hear what they are saying - but it there's a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy pulling a robe around herself - comes into the room - turns on her heel and walks away from Virgil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virgil stands there a moment - taking in what just happen steps out onto the porch.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Everything alright?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. Morning - Look,  something I want to say...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: The leaving thing - I know - hate it too.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: The other night - when we were dancing -  being with you - I felt different - special - I don't know - whole.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: That was whole? Virgil puts his hand out - she takes it - he turns to her

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: (smile)  Just for a second I felt like I could see  you - all of you.  (beat)  What you said about this Doctor, this eye guy -  I know how important it is to you...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (turns to him)  Are you sure you want to do this?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: We're just going to talk to the guy  - what could it hurt? Off Amy's smile:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A soaring shot. Amy's car - travelling across the bridge towards Manhattan.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: You're going to love the city  - so many things to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virgil in the passenger seat - windows open - taking in a sounds - new and exciting. Amy watches him as she drives.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: (laughing)  Waitwaitwait - he hasn't said he  can even do anything yet.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I know I just feel good about this.  (Amy looks to him - sees him feeling  the light against his face)  Virgil, before you lost all sight,  do you remember seeing anything at all?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Yeah, I do. I was just a baby when it  happened - but there is one thing.  (beat)  Something ... puffy. That's all I  remember about it. Everyone says it's  "clouds," but I know I had it in my hands  - so it couldn't be clouds. This puffy  thing - that was something special -  it's stayed with me all these years -  I don't know why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. RICHARD AARON, wire rims, short, stylish haircut - is a high-tech examination of Virgil's eyes. Cups attached t over his eyes. The machine, an ELECTRORETINOGRAM, emits a irritating strange flat line sound. The room is very diml Aaron adjusts an intensity dial on the machine - a series flashing lights hit Virgil's eyes. The doctor jots down a then with a flourish, spins the machine away from Virgil' pops a button emitting a detailed computer print out.  In the corner sits an older gentleman - Dr. Goldman - foc papers in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: OK - we're done. Aaron bumps up the lights and wheels his chair back over as Amy moves to join them.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Some good news. You have grade 4  posterior subscapular cataracts.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: And this is the good news?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Good news in that I should be able to  remove them with little or no damage  to your cornea.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: So -- what does that mean -  they're gone - then what?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: The cataracts are acting like a curtain -  covering the window of sight. If the disease  to the retina is reduced as much as I think  it is - there's a very good possibility  we can give you sight. Amy looks to Virgil - apprehensive. Virgil's expressionle this all in.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Sounds expensive.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: (looks to Goldman who nods imperceptibly)  We feel there's an opportunity for us all here -  I think I can get the institute to pick up the bill.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: So. Say you remove the cataracts -  do you have any idea what kind of vision I'd have? Aaron looks to Goldman.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: At this time - no. Unfortunately the  cataracts are not allowing me to see the  retinal wall. I can't tell how advanced  the retinitas pigmentosa has become.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: So you're suggesting an operation  that may or may not be successful.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: But there is a chance he  could regain his sight.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: There have been a few cases of restored  vision in adulthood to a patient blind since birth.  (moves near Virgil)  The operation is delicate, I'll admit -  but nothing as invasive as what you went  through as a child. Of course there is  always some risks with any operation -  infection, swelling - long shot stuff.  I would do both eyes at the same time  - it's basically out patient surgery. Virgil - an exhale of air. A lot to take in.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: What if it doesn't work? What if I have  the operation - with all it's risks -  and you remove the cataract - and it doesn't work. Aaron looks to Amy.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: (somber)  It would be evident that you will  never be able to see. Virgil's head shifts slightly. Not what he wanted to hear reaches out takes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: That's what I need - to think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virgil and Amy stepping out of a cab. Virgil using his ca blinder than we've seen him before. The city sounds an as him.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: This is my place - there's a park  across the street and... She stops - realizes he wants to walk in silence. They en loft building, an old converted industrial space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is an odd, loud sound which echoes three times afte bounce. As they come up on the second floor landing, a ba comes flying down the hall which Amy fumbles with - then

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Ethan! From around the corner comes ETHAN COLVIN, eight, oversiz shirt. Amy tosses him his ball.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Sorry - my mom won't let me go  outside till she gets home from work.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Well, if the super catches you playing ball in the hall, he'll have a coronary.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Never mind. Ethan,  this is my friend Virgil.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Hey, Ethan

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: (seeing his cane)  Are you blind?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Cool. See ya. And he turns and runs back up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (apologetic)  Virgil...

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Hey, the kid thinks I'm cool  - what's so bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy's loft is a wide open space - a KITCHEN facing onto a living area - a BED in the corner of the room - a WORK SP DRAFTING BOARD and DRAWING RACKS fill one side of the roo window stands a plaster SCULPTURE stuck in the corner as forgotten.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: This is where I hang my hat  - it's a bit of a mess but... Amy stops, realizes he can't see it. Virgil puts his over down.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Now, Blind 101. Help me out with a mental map.  Walk me down a straight line and show me your  place, all the obstacles. Remember once you've  told me, they can't be moved - otherwise...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Got it - here take my arm.  (they start about the room)  Couch, chair, TV to the left,  low table at.. .at 4 o'clock,  has the phone on it... They come to the Sculpture, Virgil's hand grazes across i

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Nothing. A sculpture.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: It's yours?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: My art school days - not very good. Virgil continues to feel the sculpture from top to bottom stopping during the dialogue.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: It's a mother? - holding her child - up in the air  - like she's proud? It's beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: It's not done yet -  one day I'll finish it. Virgil turns - his hand to the wall - feels a window:

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Does this window open?  I could use some air.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (moving to the windows)  I think so. As Amy throws open the window, a wind blasts through - ca stack of plans on her drafting table - blowing them acros floor.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Damn! Virgil turns, concerned, makes his way to her.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: The wind - knocked over my plans. Amy down on the floor picking them up - Virgil senses her - crouches down beside her - tries to help her pick up.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: What is this - these plans? Amy looks at Virgil - - his hand running across one of he

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Just my work - - some plans for the Atlanta  project we're bidding on - drawings of a lobby  we're finishing up, some other smaller stuff.  It's -- it's what I do. Amy realizes they mean nothing to him - he hands them bac She watches him - then standing, moves to him.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I've got to get to work. Tonight we'll do something  - we could listen to music or go out for dinner...

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: How about a movie?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: A movie?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Yeah. I haven't been in years.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Alright. A movie. I won't be long. And Amy gives him a quick kiss and dodges for the door - she forgets her purse - steps back in to see:  Virgil standing there quietly - his hand out on her plans feeling the paper - searching for the design - wanting to wanting to understand her - finding nothing there.  Amy feels uncomfortable - quietly steps out - closes the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE - the theater half full playing Woody Allen's "Annie very funny scene where Woody and Diane Keaton wrestle wit lobster.  We move in slowly and discover Virgil and Amy leaning in each other - Amy quietly describing the scene to him.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: There's these big pots and Woody's got  a huge lobster in his hand...

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Lobster - what's a lobster?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (trying not to use her hands to describe)  It's a.. .kind of like.. it's got... Then she looks to Virgil - sees he was kidding her.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (laughing)  That's it - you're on your own. Off Virgil's laugh:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BWAM - a subway train explodes past us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A collection of typical night riders - everyone keeping t themselves. Two kids sit in the corner - blasting their b Virgil stands in the middle of the train - enjoying the v Amy sits on a seat watching him.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: And they lived happily ever after.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Woody and Diane...

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: And the lobster?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Stop with the lobster.  A song comes on the radio - Virgil's head turns.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Hey - you here that? All she hears is the clatter of the subway.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What? Virgil turns towards the music - BAPPING his hands rhythm the subway car wall.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Hey - can you turn that up? The KID shrugs - CRAKKS it up. It's Gershwin's "Can't tak from Me." Virgil turns to Amy - picks up on the song - ha - he starts singing:

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: "The way you comb your hair,  The way you sip your tea..." He finds Amy, pulls her up and into an embrace as he saun down the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Virgil?!

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: (loudly)  "Can't take that away from meee" - what?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: People are watching.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Watching? Watching what?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You. Me. Everyone is staring at us.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Well - it can be embarrassing.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: (kidding)  Oh - I see.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: No - you don't. VIRGIL Touche.  "The way you make me see..."

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (turns to him)  What do you mean?!  (Virgil gives her a look -  I want the operation)  You mean it. I mean I only want  you to have the operation...

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Amy. I want the chance to see.  The chance to see Central Park,  the Brooklyn Bridge, apples, raisins, a buffalo, a carbuerator and the man  in the moon.  (beat)  But I would give all that up -  just to see this face. And Amy folds herself into Virgil - a moment - they hold - then - Amy starts to sing along with the song - Virgil - and they dance - together - in love.

dialogues.speaker: AMY/VIRGIL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: "You can't take that away from me." And the car explodes past again - and as the music dies w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: a platter of silver utensils - fine, exacting s gloved HAND comes into frame - picks up a clamp - and we to:  VIRGIL'S EYES - the clamp being used to hold it open. The are seeing is grueling - difficult to watch - but at the so fascinating it is hard to take our eyes off.  Dr. Aaron followed by Dr. Goldman - hands in the air - ma leans over Virgil - looks to the ANESTHESIOLOGIST who nod no one in particular.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: OK Virgil - let's get to it. And as he is handed a SCALPEL, we watch as it moves down the white section of the eye - and just as it feels almos unbearable to watch- -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Amy, coffee cup in hand, grab a second just poured a vending machine. She makes her way over to reveal Jenni quietly reading a book.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Coffee? It's really bad.  Jennie looks up - smiles takes the cup. Amy sits down nex They both sip for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Virgil never mentions his parents  - do they know?

dialogues.speaker: JENNIE
dialogues.text: Our mother died when I was 20 - Virgil wasn't even a teenager. And our father - he's been  gone for quite awhile.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I didn't know.  Jennie looks into her coffee - takes another sip.

dialogues.speaker: JENNIE
dialogues.text: (smile)  You're right this is bad.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: It must have been very tough on you  - taking care of Virgil alone after  your mother died.

dialogues.speaker: JENNIE
dialogues.text: He's my brother. Simple.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You don't like Virgil  doing this - do you?

dialogues.speaker: JENNIE
dialogues.text: I don't like Virgil getting hurt.  Hope is like fire, it can keep you  warm - - or it can burn you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Aaron: - focused on his exacting work. His hands move CLOSE ON: Virgil's eye. Cut open. Aaron's probe working r middle of it.

dialogues.speaker: DR. AARON
dialogues.text: There you are. And Aaron pulls out the cloudy cataract tissue - holding all to see - before he PLOPS it on a tray. Switching inst he gingerly picks up a plastic implant - moving back towa - he glances at the nurse assisting him:

dialogues.speaker: DR. AARON
dialogues.text: You know what they say, Virgil?  The eyes are the windows to the soul. Virgil can't move - listens intently as he carefully plac implant into Virgil's eye.

dialogues.speaker: DR. AARON
dialogues.text: (with a wink)  That makes us the Windex to the soul.  (he focuses)  OK, both eyes done. Let's patch him up. On a large monitor we see an EXTREME CLOSE-UP of Virgil's waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virgil being wheeled down a hall - head wrapped in bandag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he enters:

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Hello? Jennie's there - takes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Jennie?

dialogues.speaker: JENNIE
dialogues.text: How're you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: OK - a little pain,  like a tequila hang over - is Amy here?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Right here - Dr. Aaron said you did great

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: So how's my hair - I'd hate the first time  I see myself to be a bad hair day.  (Virgil reacts to a sound)  What's that?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: There's camera guys here too. WIDE - we now see the room has a small VIDEO CREW in it p document the event.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Camera guys?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: (entering)  For posterity. We're going to make you famous. We're also sending this closed  circuit to one of our conference rooms  - there's a lot of people interested in  our results today. So how you feel Virgil?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Good. Great. Fine.  (a laugh)  Nervous. Aaron moves about the room closing blinds to let in just of light.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Nothing to be nervous about.  Now Jennie and Amy, if you would  stand off to my right -- I want  Virgil to get just a slight bounce  of light. (returning to Virgil)  Ready Virgil.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Let's go. Both Amy and Jennie subconsciously adjust their hair as A to unravel the bandages.  When the bandages are completely off - all that is left a gauze patches on both eyes.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Okay - last phase -  we remove these patches and...

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: (suddenly apprehensive, hand up)  Okay - wait. So - so - what do I do?  I mean, what will I see first?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Well - we're all here - Amy,  your sister. This is new for  us all. Why don't we find out? Aaron reaches up and plucks the two patches from his eyes everyone waits.  Virgil slowly opens his eyes - he just seems to be starin bewildered - not focusing at Aaron who stands before him, holding the bandages.  Amy looks to Jennie - to Aaron - what's happening? Then f

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Well? And Virgil reacts - a startling look of recognition mixed crossing his face.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What is it Virgil?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: It's - it's - I don't know. And now for the first time we see Virgil's POV:  There is light, movement, color, shadow - but somehow it to us. There is no perception of depth -. no sense of def shape or shadow - it is as confounding to us as it is to like an explosion of Picasso, Dali and Monet on screen.  Suddenly in the midst of this chaos of images - there is and a voice emits out of what we now for the first time r a mouth. Dr. Aaron speaks again - leaning in to Virgil, w back.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Virgil - what do you see?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Something's wrong. Jennie's reaction comes pouring out of her eyes in tears, slowly, then a dam break.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Virgil what's wrong? What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Everything's fine -  it's going to take...

dialogues.speaker: JENNIE
dialogues.text: It's not fine -  don't say it's fine.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Tell me what you're seeing Virgil. Virgil suddenly pulling back - his eyes dancing around in trying to take it all in - trying to focus.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: (over everyone)  I don't know - it's all screwed up -  this can't be seeing - something's wrong - too confusing - what the hell's happening HIS POV - the camera crew coming toward him for a closer like a giant monster violently moving towards us!

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: What is it - Stop! Virgil's hand lashes out towards the camera crew - even t are 15 feet away.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: What? The camera?

dialogues.speaker: JENNIE
dialogues.text: (to the crew)  Stop moving!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Virgil, it's just the camera. The room has heightened into chaos - Virgil reacting to e he sees, any quick movement - Amy moves next to him - Aar to remain calm - Jennie assuring Virgil everything's OK.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Alright - alright - they've stopped.  OK. Let's everybody just calm down  - we'll take it slowly. Everyone settles - takes a breath.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Virgil. What can we do? They all look to Virgil - breathing heavy - his eyes swin and forth.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: I gotta focus - gotta think -  gimme a second - OK, OK - get me a  coke. Somebody?

dialogues.speaker: JENNIE
dialogues.text: He's thirsty - someone get him a drink!!

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: No - just a can - a bottle --  put something in my hands! Amy reaches over - grabs an empty coke can.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Here - how's this? Virgil takes it in his hands - closes his eyes - feels it slowly opens his eyes - trying to focus on what is in his Aaron catching on.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Good, Virgil - that's it - use your touch -  associate - now, tell me - what do you see  in your hand? Long moment. Virgil holds it up - stares hard.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: A can. Is it a can?

dialogues.speaker: JENNIE
dialogues.text: What's going on? They all look at Virgil turning the can over and over in staring intently at it - learning it.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: (beams) He's associating - one sense to the other.  His fingers tell his brain - then his brain  tells his eyes and he recognizes the image  in front of him.  (realizing)  He's seeing! Aaron looks to Amy and Jennie - they're still doubtful - to them to meet him outside.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Virgil - let's rest your eyes for today and  we'll check them again tomorrow. We should all be happy - we've got something. Virgil: not happy, just very confused. As Aaron leaves, J Virgil's hand while Amy stands there upset - watching him staring at a Soda Can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the corridor, Dr. Aaron shaking hands with Dr. Goldman exiting the near-by conference room all congratulating th doctors. As Amy exits the room - Aaron moves to her.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
